tit.j: 剣鍔文様付き円型きんつば

sen.j: 剣鍔文様付き円型きんつば（けんつばもんようつきえんけいきんつば）は、和菓子のきんつばの一種である。
sen.e: Kentsubamonyotsuki enkei Kintsuba' is one of the Japanese sweets, 'kintsuba' (Japanese confection made from red bean paste wrapped with a skin made from flour and water kneaded and spread thinly).

Kentsuba-monyo-tsuki enkei Kintsuba' (literally, samurai-sword-guard-patterned round kintsuba-cake) is one of the Japanese confectionery known as 'kintsuba' (a Japanese confection made from red bean paste wrapped with a skin made from flour and water kneaded and spread thinly).
sen.cmt: 名称英訳を補足しました。用語・表現調整。
sen.e: Kentsuba-monyo-tsuki enkei Kintsuba' (literally, samurai-sword-guard-patterned round kintsuba-cake) is one of the Japanese confectionery known as 'kintsuba' (a Japanese confection made from red bean paste wrapped with a skin made from flour and water kneaded and spread thinly).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション追加

sen.j: きんつば（金鍔）といえば、現在は四角い直方体をしたものが全国的に主流となっているが、江戸時代中期に京都で考案された当初は円形であった。
sen.e: Currently, kintsuba in the shape of rectangular parallelepiped is popular across Japan, but the early kintsuba invented in Kyoto in the middle of the Edo period had a round shape,
Currently, the kintsuba cakes in the shape of a rectangular parallelepiped are popular across Japan, but the early kintsuba invented in Kyoto in the middle of the Edo period had a round shape.
sen.cmt: パンクチュエーション、表現調整
sen.e: Currently, the kintsuba cakes in the shape of a rectangular parallelepiped are popular across Japan, but the early kintsuba invented in Kyoto in the middle of the Edo period had a round shape.

sen.j: 「剣鍔文様付き円型きんつば」は、考案当時の円形を留めていて剣鍔の文様がついているきんつばのことを指す。
sen.e: Kentsubamonyotsuki enkei Kintsuba' refers to kintsuba which has the original round shape and has 'kentsuba' (a round or squarish guard at the end of the grip of bladed Japanese weapons) pattern on its surface.

The 'Kentsuba-monyo-tsuki enkei Kintsuba' refers to kintsuba cakes which have the original round shape and a 'katana tsuba' (also called ken-tsuba, which is a round or squarish guard at the end of the grip of a bladed Japanese weapon such as a 'katana' samurai sword) pattern on the surface.

The 'Kentsuba-monyo-tsuki enkei Kintsuba' refers to kintsuba cakes which have the original round shape and a 'katana tsuba' (also called ken-tsuba, which is a round or squarish guard at the end of the grip of a bladed Japanese weapon such as a 'katana' samurai sword) pattern on the surface.

sen.j: 現在、富山県高岡市（戸出町、福岡町 (富山県)）や富山県砺波市など、全国のいくつかの地域で販売されている。
sen.e: At present, they are sold in some areas such as Takaoka City (Toide-machi, Fukuoka-machi), Toyama Prefeacure and Tonami City, Toyama Prefecture in Japan.
At present they are sold in some areas across Japan, including Takaoka City (Toide-machi, Fukuoka-machi) and Tonami City in Toyama Prefecture.
At present they are sold in some areas across Japan, including Takaoka City (Toide-machi, Fukuoka-machi) and Tonami City in Toyama Prefecture.

tit.j: 富山県高岡市戸出町の“けんつば”
tit.e: "Kentsuba' made in Tiode-machi Takaoka City, Toyama Prefecture
"Kentsuba" made in Toide-machi, Takaoka City, Toyama Prefecture
"Kentsuba" made in Toide-machi, Takaoka City, Toyama Prefecture

sen.j: 富山県高岡市戸出町には5軒の和菓子店が存在するが、いずれも「剣鍔文様付き円型きんつば」を販売している。
sen.e: There are five Japanese sweet shops in Toide-machi Takaoka City Toyama Prefecture and all of them are selling Kentsubamonyotsuki enkei Kintsuba.
There are five Japanese confectionery stores in Toide-machi, Takaoka City, Toyama Prefecture, and all of them are selling the 'Kentsuba-monyo-tsuki enkei Kintsuba.'
sen.cmt: 表現調整（米語）、パンクチュエーション
sen.e: There are five Japanese confectionery stores in Toide-machi, Takaoka City, Toyama Prefecture, and all of them are selling the 'Kentsuba-monyo-tsuki enkei Kintsuba.'

sen.j: 現地では、きんつばのことを「けんつば（剣鍔）」とも呼び、剣鍔が持っている文様が表面につけられている。
sen.e: There, 'kintsuba' is also called 'kentsuba' which has a 'kentsuba' pattern on its surface.
Locally, the 'kintsuba' is also called 'kentsuba' and given a 'kentsuba' pattern on its surface.
Locally, the 'kintsuba' is also called 'kentsuba' and given a 'kentsuba' pattern on its surface.
